2) Create a new Dynamic Web Project
3) Click Finish
4) Open Mylar Task List
5) Create new Mylar Task
6) Activate just-created Mylar Task
7) Create new File (File | New | File) named test.xml under the project's src/ directory
8) test.xml just created file is automatically opened
9) Apply Mylar Filter in Package Explorer
10) test.xml is not shown in Package Explorer
11) Close test.xml editor
12) Open file using Navigate | Open Resource | test.xml
13) test.xml is not shown in Package Explorer

The closing functionality is by design--closing a file is equivalent to decreasing interest on it when Mylar's editor management is turned on (Preferences -> Mylar).  It takes a bit of getting used to but means that the open editors match the task context.

I was able to reproduce the Package Explorer problem thanks to your project and am investigating it now...

So you will need to make the selections in the Package Explorer in order to have those elements show (see attached screenshot where I did that).
